tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE demand_forecasts (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  product_id INT,
  forecast_date DATE,
  forecast_quantity INT,
  created_at TIMESTAMP,
  updated_at TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE demand_forecasts ( 
    forecast_id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
    product_id INT, 
    forecast_date DATE, 
    forecast_amount INT 
); 
 CREATE TABLE demand_forecast_logs ( 
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
    forecast_id INT, 
    log_date TIMESTAMP, 
    log_type VARCHAR(50), 
    old_value INT, 
    new_value INT 
);

CREATE TABLE demand_forecast_audit_log (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    forecast_date DATE,
    forecast_value INT,
    user_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE demand_forecast_data (
    forecast_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    product_id INT,
    forecast_date DATE,
    forecast_value INT,
    created_by VARCHAR(50),
    created_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE demand_forecast_changes (
    change_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    forecast_id INT,
    old_forecast_value INT,
    new_forecast_value INT,
    change_timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE demand_forecasts ( 
  id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
  product_id INT, 
  forecast_value INT, 
  created_at TIMESTAMP, 
  updated_at TIMESTAMP 
);

CREATE TABLE audit_logs ( 
  id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
  event_type VARCHAR(255), 
  table_name VARCHAR(255), 
  record_id INT, 
  timestamp TIMESTAMP 
);

CREATE TABLE demand_forecast_changes (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    forecast_id INT,
    previous_value DECIMAL,
    new_value DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE forecasts (
    forecast_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    product_id INT,
    date DATE,
    forecast_value DECIMAL
)

CREATE TABLE products (
    product_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    product_name VARCHAR(255),
    category VARCHAR(50),
    description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE audit_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    action VARCHAR(50),
    table_name VARCHAR(50),
    user_id INT
)

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50),
    email VARCHAR(255)
)
